text.text_translated: The Scallion, which is a newspaper, is printed weekly and distributed free in faculty buildings, with a readership of about 10,000 students. It is written and produced entirely by students. A survey shows that the newspaper is highly valued by university students and staff for entertainment, to make their culture richer, and for work experience. However, the cost of printing newspapers is significant. Furthermore, some students do not have easy access to the paper, since the only way to obtain a copy is to physically go to university. An additional environmental issue is that a large number of copies end up as litter on campus.
